overview:
Deutsches Factoring-Portal is a online B2B Lead Generation platform for factoring targeting the German market.

Factoring is a financial transaction whereby a business sells its accounts receivable (i.e., invoices) to a third party (called a factor) at a discount in exchange for immediate money with which to finance continued business. Factoring differs from a bank loan in three main ways. First, the emphasis is on the value of the receivables (essentially a financial asset)[1], not the firmâ€™s credit worthiness. Secondly, factoring is not a loan â€“ it is the purchase of a financial asset (the receivable). Finally, a bank loan involves two parties whereas factoring involves three.

Suppliers pay per lead with no fixed costs involved.
